channel.title: Help with Hp's Tx1000 Display adapter Driver
channel.description:
Well its an old computer, that had tablet input. I just found it recently lying in my moms room. I cleaned it off, I even found the old re installation cd. Yes, it was preloaded with stock vista. which i dislike, it only has like 3gb ram, amd turbion (or something like that) X2 processor. So I installed a copy of xp (which i obtained online) As long as i don't install WGA i am fine, so i set update to when ever i want to update. I installed most of all the drivers, except for some reason my integrated nvidia 6150 isn't showing up on the display adapters and when i go to nvidia or hp's official site for the drivers, I found them but i keep getting the error of something like : "driver could not be installed. Nvidia could not find compatible Hardware"
Greatly appreciated!

item.title: Help with Hp's Tx1000 Display adapter Driver
item.dc:creator: @chillwitm888 chillwitm888
item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:8, topic:479013”]Did you use these drivers: http://www.nvidia.com/object/winxp_169.21_whql.html[/quote]I tried that one first then tried others
lol i am so stupid, the problem was that i didn’t install my chipset drivers
then it read i had a display adapter and i installed the old installer and it works
Thank you though

Read full topic
item.source: Help with Hp's Tx1000 Display adapter Driver

Did you use these drivers: http://www.nvidia.com/object/winxp_169.21_whql.html

item.title: Help with Hp's Tx1000 Display adapter Driver
item.dc:creator: @chillwitm888 chillwitm888
item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

Lin:

Assuming it’s a pre-built computer, Google the specs for the model you have and the documentation should contain the chip. If that fails, just look on the motherboard.

i did for some reason its not reading my integrated 6150 go
is there any bios setting that must be applied?

Read full topic
item.source: Help with Hp's Tx1000 Display adapter Driver

Assuming it’s a pre-built computer, Google the specs for the model you have and the documentation should contain the chip. If that fails, just look on the motherboard.

item.title: Help with Hp's Tx1000 Display adapter Driver
item.dc:creator: @chillwitm888 chillwitm888
item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

I don’t know but, I know the system did display the display adapter as 6150 go
which as seen here:http://www.cnet.com/laptops/hp-pavilion-tx1000/4507-3121_7-32305764.html is the native integrated graphics but for somereason this happens when i find the supposedly correct drivers:

How it shows up in props:

Read full topic
item.source: Help with Hp's Tx1000 Display adapter Driver

item.title: Help with Hp's Tx1000 Display adapter Driver
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:3, topic:479013”]Or just run dxdiag, or the adapter may even show up under device manager[/quote]I’m pretty sure dxdiag relies on the drivers you have installed for the model. For example if he’s using the standard VGA driver it won’t show GeForce 6150.

Read full topic
item.source: Help with Hp's Tx1000 Display adapter Driver

item.title: Help with Hp's Tx1000 Display adapter Driver

Or just run dxdiag, or the adapter may even show up under device manager

There is a program (I believe) gpuinfo that should give you the information you need.
